intro: Melampyrum barbatum, commonly known as the hairy yellow larkspur, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive spurred lower petal. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich soils.
